request_parameters.name: market\_slug
request_parameters.description: Filter markets by market slug(s). Can provide multiple values.

request_parameters.name: event\_slug
request_parameters.description: Filter markets by event slug(s). Can provide multiple values.

request_parameters.name: condition\_id
request_parameters.description: Filter markets by condition ID(s). Can provide multiple values.

request_parameters.name: tags
request_parameters.description: Filter markets by tag(s). Can provide multiple values.

request_parameters.name: status
request_parameters.description: Filter markets by status (whether they're open or closed) Available options:

request_parameters.name: min\_volume
request_parameters.description: Filter markets with total trading volume greater than or equal to this amount (USD)

request_parameters.name: limit
request_parameters.description: default:10 Number of markets to return (1-100). Default: 10 for search, 10 for regular queries. Required range: `1 <= x <= 100`

request_parameters.name: offset
request_parameters.description: default:0 Number of markets to skip for pagination Required range: `x >= 0`

request_parameters.name: start\_time
request_parameters.description: Filter markets from this Unix timestamp in seconds (inclusive)

request_parameters.name: end\_time
request_parameters.description: Filter markets until this Unix timestamp in seconds (inclusive)

pagination.description: Showchild attributes [Suggest edits](https://github.com/kurushdubash/dome-api-docs/edit/main/api-reference/endpoint/get-markets.mdx) [Raise issue](https://github.com/kurushdubash/dome-api-docs/issues/new?title=Issue%20on%20docs&body=Path:%20/api-reference/endpoint/get-markets) [Previous](https://docs.domeapi.io/) [Trade HistoryFetches historical trade data with optional filtering by market, condition, token, time range, and user's wallet address.\\ \\ Next](https://docs.domeapi.io/api-reference/endpoint/get-trade-history) Ctrl+I Get Markets cURL Copy

domeapi_endpoints.real_time_performance_considerations: Market metadata endpoint. Markets themselves update infrequently; refresh periodically or when needed.
domeapi_endpoints.use_case_details: Search and discover prediction markets with various filters including status, volume, and categories. Foundation for market discovery and selection.

request_parameters.name: start\_time
request_parameters.description: Unix timestamp (in seconds) for start of time range

request_parameters.name: end\_time
request_parameters.description: Unix timestamp (in seconds) for end of time range

request_parameters.name: interval
request_parameters.description: default:1 Interval length: 1 = 1m, 60 = 1h, 1440 = 1d. Defaults to 1m. ⚠️ Note: There are range limits for `interval` — specifically: - `1` (1m): max range 1 week - `60` (1h): max range 1 month - `1440` (1d): max range 1 year Available options:

candlesticks.description: Array of market candlestick data, where each element is a tuple containing candlestick data array and token metadata Tuple of \[candlestick\_data\_array, token\_metadata\] Required array length: `2` elements - object\[\] - object

domeapi_endpoints.real_time_performance_considerations: Historical data endpoint with configurable intervals. For real-time price updates, combine with WebSocket market price streams.
domeapi_endpoints.use_case_details: Fetch historical price data in candlestick format for charting and technical analysis. Supports multiple time intervals for detailed market analysis.

request_parameters.name: eoa
request_parameters.description: EOA (Externally Owned Account) wallet address. Either `eoa` or `proxy` must be provided, but not both.

request_parameters.name: proxy
request_parameters.description: Proxy wallet address. Either `eoa` or `proxy` must be provided, but not both.

request_parameters.name: with\_metrics
request_parameters.description: Whether to include wallet trading metrics (total volume, trades, and markets). Pass `true` to include metrics. Metrics are computed only when explicitly requested for performance reasons. Available options:

request_parameters.name: start\_time
request_parameters.description: Optional start date for metrics calculation (Unix timestamp in seconds). Only used when `with_metrics=true`.

request_parameters.name: end\_time
request_parameters.description: Optional end date for metrics calculation (Unix timestamp in seconds). Only used when `with_metrics=true`.

eoa.description: The EOA (Externally Owned Account) wallet address

wallet\\_metrics.description: Trading metrics for this wallet (only present when with\_metrics=true) Showchild attributes [Suggest edits](https://github.com/kurushdubash/dome-api-docs/edit/main/api-reference/endpoint/get-wallet.mdx) [Raise issue](https://github.com/kurushdubash/dome-api-docs/issues/new?title=Issue%20on%20docs&body=Path:%20/api-reference/endpoint/get-wallet) [Previous](https://docs.domeapi.io/api-reference/endpoint/get-candlestick) [Wallet Profit-and-LossFetches the \*\*realized\*\* profit and loss (PnL) for a specific wallet address over a specified time range and granularity. \*\*Note:\*\* This will differ to what you see on Polymarket's dashboard since Polymarket showcases historical unrealized PnL. This API tracks realized gains only - from either confirmed sells or redeems. We do not realize a gain/loss until a finished market is redeemed.\\ \\ Next](https://docs.domeapi.io/api-reference/endpoint/get-wallet-pnl) Ctrl+I Get Wallet cURL Copy

domeapi_endpoints.real_time_performance_considerations: On-demand wallet data retrieval. Poll periodically for balance updates or use in combination with WebSocket order feeds.
domeapi_endpoints.use_case_details: Monitor wallet balances, positions, and profit/loss metrics. Key for portfolio management and performance tracking.

request_parameters.name: user
request_parameters.description: User wallet address to fetch activity for

request_parameters.name: start\_time
request_parameters.description: Filter activity from this Unix timestamp in seconds (inclusive)

request_parameters.name: end\_time
request_parameters.description: Filter activity until this Unix timestamp in seconds (inclusive)

request_parameters.name: market\_slug
request_parameters.description: Filter activity by market slug

request_parameters.name: condition\_id
request_parameters.description: Filter activity by condition ID

request_parameters.name: limit
request_parameters.description: default:100 Number of activities to return (1-1000) Required range: `1 <= x <= 1000`

request_parameters.name: offset
request_parameters.description: default:0 Number of activities to skip for pagination Required range: `x >= 0`

domeapi_endpoints.real_time_performance_considerations: REST endpoint provides on-demand data retrieval. Rate limits apply based on subscription tier.
domeapi_endpoints.use_case_details: Track user activity including merges, splits, and trades. Useful for user behavior analysis and activity monitoring.

request_parameters.description: End time in Unix timestamp (seconds)

request_parameters.description: default:100 Maximum number of trades to return (default: 100)

request_parameters.name: offset
request_parameters.description: default:0 Number of trades to skip for pagination Required range: `x >= 0`

trades.description: Array of executed trades Showchild attributes

domeapi_endpoints.real_time_performance_considerations: REST endpoint provides historical snapshots. For real-time trade notifications, use WebSocket order subscriptions.
domeapi_endpoints.use_case_details: Access historical trade data with filtering by market, time range, and user address. Critical for trade history displays and transaction reconciliation.

request_parameters.name: granularity
request_parameters.description: Available options:

request_parameters.name: start\_time
request_parameters.description: Defaults to first day of first trade if not provided.

domeapi_endpoints.real_time_performance_considerations: Market metadata endpoint. Markets themselves update infrequently; refresh periodically or when needed.

request_parameters.name: token\_id

request_parameters.name: at\_time
request_parameters.description: Optional Unix timestamp (in seconds) to fetch a historical market price. If not provided, returns the most real-time price available.

at\\_time.description: The timestamp for which the price was fetched (Unix timestamp in seconds)

domeapi_endpoints.real_time_performance_considerations: Returns most recent available price. For continuous real-time updates, consider using WebSocket subscriptions.

domeapi_endpoints.real_time_performance_considerations: REST endpoint provides historical snapshots. For real-time trade notifications, use WebSocket order subscriptions.
domeapi_endpoints.use_case_details: Access historical trade data with filtering by market, time range, and user address. Critical for trade history displays and transaction reconciliation.

request_parameters.name: polymarket\_market\_slug
request_parameters.description: The Polymarket market slug(s) to find matching markets for. To get multiple markets at once, provide the query param multiple times with different slugs. Can not be combined with kalshi\_event\_ticker.

request_parameters.name: kalshi\_event\_ticker
request_parameters.description: The Kalshi event ticker(s) to find matching markets for. To get multiple markets at once, provide the query param multiple times with different tickers. Can not be combined with polymarket\_market\_slug.

domeapi_endpoints.real_time_performance_considerations: Market metadata endpoint. Markets themselves update infrequently; refresh periodically or when needed.
domeapi_endpoints.use_case_details: Search and discover prediction markets with various filters including status, volume, and categories. Foundation for market discovery and selection.

domeapi_endpoints.description: WebSocket Subscribe - Real-time order updates with filtering by users, condition IDs, or market slugs

request_parameters.name: action
request_parameters.description: Must be `"subscribe"`

request_parameters.name: platform
request_parameters.description: Must be `"polymarket"`

request_parameters.name: version
request_parameters.description: Currently `1`

request_parameters.name: type
request_parameters.description: Must be `"orders"`

request_parameters.name: filters
request_parameters.description: Object containing filter criteria (see filter types below)

domeapi_endpoints.real_time_performance_considerations: WebSocket connection provides push-based updates with minimal latency (<100ms typical). Subscription limits vary by tier: Free (2 subscriptions, 5 wallets), Dev (500 subscriptions, 500 wallets), Enterprise (custom). Use filtered subscriptions to reduce bandwidth and processing overhead. Maintain connection health with ping/pong frames.
domeapi_endpoints.use_case_details: Subscribe to receive real-time order updates with flexible filtering. Supports three filter types: 1) User addresses - track specific wallets or use wildcard for all trades (Dev tier), 2) Condition IDs - monitor specific market outcomes, 3) Market slugs - track all activity in specific markets. Essential for building live order flow displays, execution monitoring, and market activity tracking in trading terminals.

domeapi_endpoints.description: The update action allows you to modify the filters of an existing subscription without creating a new one. This is more efficient than unsubscribing and re-subscribing, as it maintains the same subscription ID.

request_parameters.name: action
request_parameters.description: Must be `"update"`

request_parameters.name: subscription_id
request_parameters.description: The ID of the subscription you want to update

request_parameters.name: platform
request_parameters.description: Must be `"polymarket"`

request_parameters.name: version
request_parameters.description: Currently `1`

request_parameters.name: type
request_parameters.description: Must be `"orders"`

request_parameters.name: filters
request_parameters.description: New filter configuration (same format as subscribe)

domeapi_endpoints.real_time_performance_considerations: WebSocket provides push-based real-time updates with minimal latency. Ideal for live trading terminals requiring immediate order and execution notifications.
domeapi_endpoints.use_case_details: Real-time streaming for order and trade updates. Action: update. Enables low-latency order flow monitoring and execution tracking.

domeapi_endpoints.description: The unsubscribe action allows you to stop receiving updates for a specific subscription without disconnecting from the WebSocket entirely. This is useful when you want to manage multiple subscriptions independently.

request_parameters.name: action
request_parameters.description: Must be `"unsubscribe"`

request_parameters.name: version
request_parameters.description: Currently `1`

request_parameters.name: subscription_id
request_parameters.description: The subscription ID you received when you subscribed (e.g., `"sub_wjhhq8dny2"`)

domeapi_endpoints.real_time_performance_considerations: WebSocket provides push-based real-time updates with minimal latency. Ideal for live trading terminals requiring immediate order and execution notifications.
domeapi_endpoints.use_case_details: Real-time streaming for order and trade updates. Action: unsubscribe. Enables low-latency order flow monitoring and execution tracking.

market_data_endpoints.description: The subscribe action allows you to receive real-time order updates from Polymarket. You can filter orders by different criteria to receive only the data you need.

trade_history_endpoints.description: The subscribe action allows you to receive real-time order updates from Polymarket. You can filter orders by different criteria to receive only the data you need.

wallet_management_endpoints.security_considerations: Requires API key authentication. Wallet addresses should be validated. Rate limits apply per tier.
Requires API key authentication. Wallet addresses should be validated. Rate limits apply per tier.

orderbook_synchronization_endpoints.real_time_performance_considerations: Provides historical orderbook snapshots. Use for backtesting and analysis rather than live trading synchronization.

orderbook_synchronization_endpoints.description: The subscribe action allows you to receive real-time order updates from Polymarket. You can filter orders by different criteria to receive only the data you need.
orderbook_synchronization_endpoints.update_frequency: Real-time push updates on order changes
orderbook_synchronization_endpoints.real_time_performance_considerations: WebSocket provides immediate order update notifications. Maintain local orderbook state and apply incremental updates for optimal performance. Supports filtering by users, condition IDs, or market slugs.
